description: A celebration of Brentford's creativity, its industrial past, and it's riverside communities, with artist studios and pop-up exhibitions spread across 8 venues along a one-mile walking route running from Kew Bridge down to Johnson's Island.

events.name: Creative Mile: open studios and pop-up exhibitions
Creative Mile: open studios and pop-up exhibitions

facilities: Family activities during open house festival

factsheet.heading: Art
paragraphs: Creative Mile includes paintings, ceramics, jewellery, textiles, photography, mosaics, sculpture, and digital art from around sixty artists, all of them either based in Brentford or the borough of Hounslow.

There'll be art round every corner in the Musical Museum, pop-up exhibition space at Studio Flox, next door to Watermans, and artists opening up their studios at Johnson's Island and The Loft on Catherine Wheel Road (the 'blue road').

factsheet.heading: Families
paragraphs: The London Museum of Water and Steam is laying on a Mini Family Festival full of art-themed activities over the weekend of 4th and 5th September, 10am to 4pm.

On Saturday, have a go a salt-dough sculptures and arts and crafts including knitting and puppets. Or help to create a large 3D model of Thomas Wicksteed, the Museum’s steam loco. On Sunday, the salt-dough sculptures and Thomas Wicksteed model are back, and joined by more arts and crafts including badge making and community townscapes.
Activities are free; however, admission applies if you wish to visit inside the London Museum of Water & Steam.

factsheet.heading: Culture and Heritage
paragraphs: The Creative Mile takes you on a journey through Brentford’s industrial past and its vibrant, creative riverside community. It also includes a cluster of West London's heritage and culture venues.

See the machinery that used to power the city's water supply at the Water and Steam Museum, have a go on an early electronic keyboard at the Musical Museum, or discover Watermans' year-round programme of cinema, fringe theatre, exhibitions and workshops.

factsheet.heading: Find out more
paragraphs: Find out more about the venues and artists taking part in Creative Mile on our website

factsheet.heading: Venues
paragraphs:
Creative Mile takes place across eight venues: 
1) The London Museum of Water and Steam (family festival)
2) The Musical Museum (pop-up exhibitions)
3) Watermans (Mark Farid's Seeing I)
4) Studio Flox (pop-up exhibitions)
5) The Loft (open studios)
6) Duke of London (classic-car-garage-cum-exhibition-space)
7) The Brentford Project Event Space (Redlees artists)
8) Johnson's Island (artist colony)
